    CPI: clock cycles per instruction (IPC: CPI çš„å€’æ•°)

CPUÂ executionÂ time=CPUÂ clockÂ cyclesÃ—ClockÂ cycleÂ time=CPUÂ clockÂ cyclesClockÂ rate \begin{aligned} \text{CPU execution time} &= \text{CPU clock cycles} \times \text{Clock cycle time} \\ &= \frac{\text{CPU clock cycles}}{\text{Clock rate}} \end{aligned}CPUÂ executionÂ timeâ€‹=CPUÂ clockÂ cyclesÃ—ClockÂ cycleÂ time=ClockÂ rateCPUÂ clockÂ cyclesâ€‹â€‹

CPUÂ clockÂ cycles=InstructionsÂ countÃ—AverageÂ cyclesÂ perÂ instruction\begin{aligned} \text{CPU clock cycles} &= \text{Instructions count} \times \text{Average cycles per instruction} \end{aligned}CPUÂ clockÂ cyclesâ€‹=InstructionsÂ countÃ—AverageÂ cyclesÂ perÂ instructionâ€‹

CPUÂ executionÂ time=CPUÂ clockÂ cyclesÃ—ClockÂ cycleÂ time=CPUÂ clockÂ cyclesClockÂ rate\begin{aligned} \text{CPU execution time} &= \text{CPU clock cycles} \times \text{Clock cycle time} \\ &= \frac{\text{CPU clock cycles}}{\text{Clock rate}} \end{aligned} CPUÂ executionÂ timeâ€‹=CPUÂ clockÂ cyclesÃ—ClockÂ cycleÂ time=ClockÂ rateCPUÂ clockÂ cyclesâ€‹â€‹

performance=1CPUÂ executionÂ time \begin{aligned} \text{performance} &= \frac{1}{\text{CPU execution time}} \end{aligned}performanceâ€‹=CPUÂ executionÂ time1â€‹â€‹

â€œProcessor X is n times fast than Yâ€ is

n=CPUÂ executionÂ timeÂ ofÂ YCPUÂ executionÂ timeÂ ofÂ X \begin{aligned} \text{n} &= \frac{\text{CPU execution time of Y}}{\text{CPU execution time of X}} \end{aligned}nâ€‹=CPUÂ executionÂ timeÂ ofÂ XCPUÂ executionÂ timeÂ ofÂ Yâ€‹â€‹

IPS: instructions per second

IPS=CPUÂ frequencyCPI=1CPUÂ clockÂ cyclesÃ—CPUÂ executionÂ time \begin{aligned} \text{IPS} &= \frac{\text{CPU frequency}}{\text{CPI}} &= \frac{1}{\text{CPU clock cycles} \times \text{CPU execution time}} \end{aligned}IPSâ€‹=CPICPUÂ frequencyâ€‹â€‹=CPUÂ clockÂ cyclesÃ—CPUÂ executionÂ time1â€‹â€‹
